Reviews.Title: “Nicely located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ronley01
Reviews.Content: Every now and then you get lucky when picking a hotel. I don't have a personal favourite hotel in Paris, but I try to find a hotel in a convenient location. That normally means close to a metro station on the line that takes me to my meeting place the quickest way. Of course the quartier should be nice as well, with a good choice of restaurants close by. This time, I was looking for a place close to Tour Montparnasse. On Google maps, I found this hotel and it did provide the basic needs for a business stay: bed, shower, desk and internet connection. I got lucky this time, because this hotel is very nice indeed, great value for money. It is not your standard cubboard type of Parisian room, but both bedroom and bathroom were quite spacious. They serve a nice, but fairly basic, breakfast buffet and you can order your coffee freshly brewed. The location is just great. Metro station close at hand and the Montparnasse area is nice and lively, certainly if you are there as a tourist. Rue Daguerre and the surrounding streets have plenty of restaurants to choose from. One thing though, what is it with French hotels and the showers? They seem to have invented a different holding system for the shower head for each hotel in the country and more than half are just not working properly. All in all great value for money, friendly and helpful personnel, nice rooms and a perfect location to discover the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: francophilesSpain
Reviews.Content: We were impressed with this hotel. The welcome was warm, and all of the staff were pleasant and helpful.The room was comfortable, very clean, and everything worked. There was satellite television and a 'fridge in the room, the bed was comfortable, and the heating effective (important in November!) We thought the breakfast buffet at ten euros good value. Plenty of shops and restaurants round about, and handy for both the metro and the RER with direct access to Charles de Gaulle airport. Definitely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for short stay”
Reviews.Author: Chili4417
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights, on a stopover heading elsewhere in France by train. I picked this hotel primarily on the basis of proximity to Montparnasse train station for a very early departure. The hotel was of a good standard, it was quite small and a bit dated but it was clean and the staff were friendly. On our night of arrival the man on night duty gave us a very good recommendation for a reasonably priced restaurant only a couple of streets away and was very helpful providing us with tips on what to see etc. I feel that most Paris hotels overstate their proximity to train stations, so when it says it is very close this is actually more like 10-15 minute walk, including crossing a couple of roads, which is a bit cumbersome with suitcases but wasn't too much hassle really - you just keep expecting to see it as you leave the station which makes the journey seem a bit longer! I would recommend this hotel for a short stay, it is close to metro stops which is good for access to more central areas of Paris, and has some very good restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “small but cozy”
Reviews.Author: joy w
Reviews.Content: Small room facing the street, but excellent soundproof windows provided an interesting view without too much noise. Great neighborhood which was very residential with lots of shops and restaurants. Breakfast was pricey, but lots of neighborhood alternatives around. Staff was helpful and friendly. Be prepared to walk your luggage up.

Reviews.Title: “hotel montparnasse Daguerre”
Reviews.Author: Angela B
Reviews.Content: NOT a 3 star hotel! No laundry facilities and an elevator that only fits 1 person and a suitcase. Great if I was expecting a 2 star.

Reviews.Title: “Honest Opinion from World Travellers”
Reviews.Author: Deb G
Reviews.Content: We were here for 8 nights. We had contemplated getting an apartment, but decided on this hotel and wished we had gone with the apartment for various reasons, the most being the ability to cook our own dinner as dinner expenses added up quickly. Breakfast would have been better to buy as well as the markets are great. Location - ok. Closest Metro stop is Gaité on Avenue Main, which we found we had to transfer trains a lot more than the Denfert-Rochereau stop at the top of the street. Train station (Denfert-Rochereau) was farther and if you are not packed lightly, it's not a fun walk, otherwise the walk would be fine. Markets and bakeries on this street are great. Try the Denfert Cafe for dinner - prix fix menu - very good. Down the street a bit is rue Gaité where you can find a cafe for happy hour drinks (although still 5 EU for a draft beer) and some good restaurants. In this area, (not on this street) is Moules Frites restaurant - good value for your money. Hotel - Old - needs upgrading. Smelly/stale air as no a/c. Noisy rooms at front. We had to switch rooms half way through due to noise because we had to keep window open for air. Our fridge in that room didn't work and, because it was the weekend, nobody could fix it for us. Spoiled the cheese we had purchased. Very small rooms, although the one on the ground floor was a little bigger than our original on the 1st floor. Staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast is way too expensive - bakeries down the street are better. OK hotel, but wouldn't recommend for more than 3 days. General Tips - Weekly Metro pass is well worth it. SHARE a photo session for 4 EU (4 pics) as you will need a pic for the pass or bring your own from home. The space is only about 3/4" square. Museum Pass was worth it for us to save on entry fees, although not one place even looked at the expiry date. Also, not sure if it was timing or what, but we only got to bypass the queue at Musee D'Orsay. Still had to get in line everywhere else for security reasons. Eiffel Tower - we pre-booked our elevator time - worth it as there was a 2-hour wait for the elevator to go up. You are on your own to come down though, so keep that wait in mind when you're up there. Tourist areas are just that - reminded us of Niagara Falls souvenir shops.

Reviews.Title: “Will recommend to everyone!”
Reviews.Author: Sian H
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with a very central location and close proximity to metro Gaire and train station. Lovely little street with bustling cafes and restaurants and shops nearby. The hotel itself was impeccable and worth more than the star rating it is given. Great value for money. Clean, modern, friendly staff and I will definitely be staying here again and recommending to all.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Little Hotel - Will Definitely Return!”
Reviews.Author: LaLa2460
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in July and absolutely loved it. If you are on a budget, and can't afford a luxury hotel with a view of the Eiffel Tower, than I would highly recommend the Hotel Montparnasse Daguerre. It is a very clean and cheerful old-style Parisian hotel, with nice-sized rooms that are well-kept, pleasant, and comfortable. The rooms all had flat-screen TVs with numerous channels in various languages, a large desk fan for air circulation, thick windows that fully block the street noise when closed, and a cabinet with extra pillows and blankets, should you want them. The staff was super nice and accommodating, and even printed our airplane boarding passes for us, which was extremely helpful! And they all spoke English, which is really helpful for English-speaking travelers like myself. They also had lots of helpful traveling and tourist information/pamphlets to pass on, if you needed it. The location was great too, as there were several restaurants, grocery stores, bakeries, and even a bank, all located on the same street. And the hotel is only a 5 minute walk from the Metro. Best of all, the prices were very reasonable, and even included a full breakfast! I will definitely be returning to this hotel the next time I got to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, terrific staff”
Reviews.Author: Bryan G
Reviews.Content: Well located in close proximity to lots of places to grab groceries and wine. Just do some exporing and you should find them easily. There is a Monoprix nearby with a good selection, as well as two open air markets. Many Metro stops are nearby, as is easy access to the Denfert Rochereau station where you can take the train to CDG airport. The lift is small, but does the job. The room I had was a very good size, with a large bathroom. Very comfortable, and included a small fridge. Perfect for storing the wine and cheese to have after a long day of walking. Staff were very helpful any time I needed it, and all spoke English (and tolerated my poor French).

Reviews.Title: “Basic charm, small elevator in between floors, narrow staircase”
Reviews.Author: KimNeoh
Reviews.Content: Pluses- the bathroom is sparkling clean, close to eateries and the reception was excellent in providing assistance when we enquired on the transportation. Kudos to both Sophie and Sarah! Negatives - our room was decorated in red upholstery and curtains - makes it look really dark, not very welcoming. Its about 10 mins brisk walk from the Denfert Rochereau station - can be a struggle if you are lugging heavy bags.

Reviews.Title: “Great train location within Paris & CDG”
Reviews.Author: tayie83
Reviews.Content: Only there for one night. We chose this location (coming back from the french countryside) mainly because it was near the Gare Montparnasse (where we came from) and also walking distance to Daguerre station, where we could catch the RER in the morning back to CDG. It turned out to be an excellent choice. The concierge was super super helpful. He gave us valuable info on trains, tourist stops and great restaurants around. We got a bit of sight-seeing done by going to the Tour Montparnasse (right before dawn) and ate @ La Coupole, which was around the area. The best part is everything was within walking distance. No train ticket needed. 5am, we walked to the train station (15mn) and got to the airport on time for our 7am flight back to NY

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: musiccat
Reviews.Content: Liked this hotel very much. Staff friendly and helpful. Room was relatively small but you expect that in Paris. The room looked out onto the courtyard so it was quiet. Only problem was lack of coathangers in wardrobe and for the kind of hotel it is they could have served fresh coffee instead of coffee pre-prepared in thermos jugs. Breakfast very good otherwise. We stayed in a more modest hotel in Bruges the week before and they had a fantastic coffee machine in the breakfast room!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: bumbleona
Reviews.Content: The price was excellent for the position and cleaness of the hotel. The reception was kind and rooms were little but very clean and welcoming. Very nice street and not noisy hotel. I'll come back surely :)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Hope022
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on a typically French street, with lots to see. The hotel itself is clean, lovely, with a lift, nice personnel, etc. It was a very good choice and good value for money. It is also near main avenues and the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Every penny worths”
Reviews.Author: gtanirtr
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel via internet and choose for the localisation and the price. Hotel is on Rue daguerre, a very long street. Very good value for the money. Helpful and nice staff. Our room was No.1 on the entrance floor, not so big but it is quite enough for two. The room is very clean. Accessible by RER from the airport ( Denfert-Rochereau stop).

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: Anywhereitsunny
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights, the first night we got bitten by bed bugs, which we think were in the wood in the wardrobe, so when we used the extra blanket/pillows, they were then on the bed. This itself was bad enough, but the staff's reaction was worse. They blamed it on mosquitos, saying it couldn't be bed bugs, we have both travelled plenty to know the differnece between the two bites, and when we asked for spray they didnt have any because they " havent heard of the hotel having bed bugs before". After this there was no apology, making it worse. However they did move us to another room, which in the end didnt have any bed bugs, and we learnt not to use the extra blanket/pillows! However, on the last night we smelled cigarette smoke quite strongly, even though the bathroom door/room door/windows were all shut, there was no extraction fan for the smoke to seep in, and there was no smell in the hallway, so the only thing it could have been was coming from the room below, and someone making its way into the room. The room itself was disappointing. There is no coffee/tea making facilities, which we expected as the minimum requirement for a hotel at this price. The room & bathroom was quite a good size, and it was very clean & well presented. The staff all spoke english, it seemed to have good information about the city, and its location is quite good, with the Metro 150 metres away with direct links to the airport, and plenty of cafes/restaurants and lots of nice bakerys if you dont want to spend 10E for breakfast! Overall we were quite disappointed, and felt the first nights experienced spoilt the experience, and even though we felt it was nice and clean, with a good sized room, we felt it wasnt good value for money, and we wouldnt recommend this hotel. We hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Jbelly77
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Gare Montparnasse on the Air France coach from CDG - Hotel Daguerre is 5minutes walk away from the station. The hotel lobby is small but clean and the staff were always friendly. The steps up the 6 floors are steep and winding, the lift is only big enough to fit 2 people (with a suitcase at a big squeeze). Our room was on the 5th floor, on a small corridor shared with 4 other rooms. The room was pretty small, but clean. There was a TV, a fridge and a safe. The en suite was adequate and clean. The room was extremely hot though, there's no air con. There was a fan though, but it didn't really help. The street below isn't too noisy through the night but might be if you have the window open in the morning with the bin men. The hotel is in a fantastic location - Rue Daguerre is full of bars and restaurants. Bld du Montparnasse is a short walk away - loads of bars and restaurants. Shopping is only a stones throw away too. We walked to the major attractions, but there's a metro station very close by. All in all, the hotel is great value for money. If I were to stay for more than the 3 nights that I did, I think I'd pay more for somewhere with air con - it's really very hot! I'd definitely stay there again for short breaks though. In Paris it's unlikely you'll spend much time in your room anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad value for money”
Reviews.Author: GitteK
Reviews.Content: I booked this alledgedly 3 star hotel via Bookings.com and one of my main search criteria was "free WIFI in the room" for my laptop. This is promised on the website - but it turned out to be fraud, because the WIFI connection does not work on the top floor, where my shoebox single room was located. And the receptionist didn't ever bother to apologize, on the contrary she implied that it was my own fault for having booked a single room. And I do speak a passable French, so it was not a question of communications problems. Consequently I had to carry laptop, recharger etc. down the to lobby, where there is no comfortable workspace for using your laptop. And moreover, if you want to use the hotel lobby stationary PC instead you will have to PAY for an access card ! I have stayed in many budget hotels in Paris, so I am used to small rooms, but this one was outrageous. I cannot imagine what it would be like to stay here for 2-3 weeks, also considering the 50x50 cm closet you had for storing your clothes. In the morning I had the chance to peep into other rooms during cleaning, and they were much more comfortable. They had simply given me the worst room in the whole hotel - and I paid 550 euros for 7 nights. Single rooms in Parisian budget hotels like this one (which certainly deserves no more than max 2 stars) are currently obtainable for about 58-63 euros. Funny thing is that I had asked about the size of the room in an email to the hotel, and had the reply "15 m2". They must have some pretty small m2's in Paris to be able to cram 15 m2 into my room,, because according to my calculations the room was no more max 9 m2. This I also explained to the female receptionist, but she couldn't care less. As you may have discovered, the main problem with this hotel is their attitude towards the customers. Another peculiarity: On arrival I found towels plus a washcloth in my (very clean) bathroom. How nice, but then again - it should be expectable in a 3 star hotel. But the next day there was no new washcloth, so I asked for one in the reception. Same problem next day - the maid had not given me a clean washcloth. So I went to the reception yet again, and this time I had the explanation, that I was only supposed to be given ONE ! One washcloth for a full week is a tad below my hygienic standards, I must admit. After I had met the maid in the stairs and explained directly to her about the washcloth issue, I ended up getting a new one each day - but I suppose that equalled to being upgraded to DeLuxe. In all fairness must be added the 4 positive traits of the room: Free view to the north, postcard pretty, of Montmartre and SacrÃ© Coeur Bathroom cleanliness Mini-fridge Firm matress I cannot recommend this hotel, because you can do much better with your money in Paris - and giving false information on the website is simply unforgiveable. BTW, the ride to CDG with taxi cost me 50 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, great value”
Reviews.Author: BrickLaner
Reviews.Content: This is a compact hotel, by which I mean it has about 30 rooms on six floors, and all the rooms appear to be on the small side. The lobby area is very smart, with a few comfortable armchairs. The rooms themselves are small, and have an oldfashioned look, but everything works and is wonderfully clean. I must mention that the bed was unbelievably comfortable, and we had some of the best nights sleep we've had in months: better than at home! The reception staff were all helpful, friendly and happy to speak english. We never made it to breakfast although it is served until 10 (that bed!) but the cafe-au-lait and tartine at the Cafe/Tabac Naguerre two hundred yards down the road was delicious, and considerably cheaper. We stayed four nights, having originally planned to spend our first night there and then look around. That probably says it all. For eating out, either explore Rue Daguerre, or walk back down Avenue du Maine, turn right down Rue de Gaite and you will come to Edgar Quinet metro station. Round here there is a real bustle even in August, and loads of places to choose from. It isn't a pampering, luxury style hotel - Paris itself will have to do that for you - but it is very good base and excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice in quiet area”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne_pl
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in a very nice part of Paris, on rue Dageurre you can find lots of nice cafes, restaurants, bakeries and many shops, there is actually little market there, it is not too far away from the city centre, close to metro stations so there is an easy access to places you are going to see in Paris, very easy connection to CDG airport - 7 min to RER station - you go directly to the airport. About hotel: very positive general impression, rooms are spotlessly clean, no unpleasant smell, staff helpful, yes I agree lift is extremely small, reasonable price, I booked this hotel via Internet - any problems. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great find.......”
Reviews.Author: JETSETMadchesterUk
Reviews.Content: We decided to pay just a little more than the lead in hotels and it paid off - this is a gem of a hotel in that it has a great position to get around Paris and beyond (Metro 5 mins walk, Rail 10 mins), very clean, well ventillated and safe. Bear in mind that Paris hotels at the low-medium end tend to have smaller rooms and facilities - thats the way it is. If you tend to Supersize at meal times you may find it a little tight ! American visitors will find most of the rooms in Paris small compared to even motels back home, but, hey, live the experience !

Reviews.Title: “Lovely..but a little noisy”
Reviews.Author: Little_Emski
Reviews.Content: Lovely little hotel, we got a transfer shuttle from airport so not hard to find atall. Tip: book paris shuttle via easyjet, not direct like me, bout 50 euros cheaper!! Hotel a little noisy at night, can here everyone in hallway, upstairs, etc. BUT, it was fine, its a budget hotel so shouldnt expect luxury! Spotlessly clean, helpful staff, just an hours walk from Eiffel Tower, 45 mins from Notre Damm & The Louvre. We like to walk but the metro is less than 50 yds from Hotel. Nice restaurants around, from hotel turn right and then right again at end of street take 2nd right, this street is full of restuarants, a lovely one does amazing potato dishes, cant remember what its called but you have to que for a table so thats a good sign!! DIdnt have breakfast there, theres soo many patisseries and coffee shops that are in near vacinity and cheaper. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “I would stay there again just to be in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: gogoguy
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean; the bed was clean and comfy. I slept thru the night as I expected to do.The staff was very helpful as I expected, and spoke English as expected.If you want to e-mail, rent a puter there too. Breakfast was served there too but I never ate there.. a couple of patisseries on R.Daguerre.. the French way! The room price was right, (85 Euros) a lot below the usual Paris prices. Room was somewhat smaller than an American-style room but that's Paris. (you want "large", pay large) You want "air", go elsewhere. (in May it was just fine) They have a room to store suitcases and they stored ours for two weeks while my daughter and I travelled to Nantes and Spain!! free too, but we stayed two more nights upon returning from Spain. ( ten nights in all). Yes the elevator was very old "french" in that it was like a phonebooth, literally. (you want big elevator, prices go up too). Didn't bother me though. I thought it was quaint and did the job when I needed it. Some rooms face the back alley;some face Rue Daguerre. We had both situations. A bit noisy on the 3rd floor do the the street, but I closed the window, and voila!! Much quieter. (you want a park setting out front, pay park prices) Steet is narrow, and one way. Traffic at night was minimal, but very busy in the day. (love that busyness! You know you're in the Paris!!) Bathrooms and showers were no problem. (even had electric towel rack to dry my socks and gotchies) Central too.. 10 min walk from Montparnasse trains,(Montparnasse Tower is 2/3 the ht. of the Eiffel T.) and 10 mins from subway stop, the other direction. ( and Catacombes!!) I'd stay there again without at doubt. Nice "corner store" owner, just across the street and fridge in our room. (Montparnasse Cemetary is 5 minutes away on foot too)

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: baileys-minis
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 3 night stay in paris at this hotel the daguerre. well what can i say, i wouldnt stay here again. the staff were very rude barring one lady, they couldnt speak any english, so if you dont know any french whatsoever, i wouldnt stay here. the rooms are very small, you have to literally stand on the beds to get around your room, the lift is tiny only enough room for 1 person and 1 small case.the cleaners leave there cleaning items and hoovers all over the hall and stairs, on one occasion i literally tripped up over it and nearly fell down the stairs. the breakfast is very nice but its not worth 10 euros per breakfast. The hotel is quite close to everything, so position is not too bad. basically paris is lovely but i wouldnt return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed here in twin rooms on a two night break this was our first time in Paris. The hotel was well presented,albeit small,but somewhere clean to put your head down at night,with an excellent breakfast to see you through the day.However,the rooms we were in do need some new furniture,e.g dressing table and chair are a bit the worse for wear,we did get a new carpet the day we arrived though. The hotel is just round the corner from the metro and the montparnasse tower,we went to the very top of the tower for spectacular views of Paris. Some reviews point out that the hotel is too far from the centre of Paris,however,we suggest that you sus out the metro as we did therefore,getting around was a breeze.We also bought a metro travel 3 day pass,excellent value and saves waiting in a que to get tickets. Christine,Julia,Margaret and Carol.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here 2 weeks ago in May 06 and found the hotel both great and strange. The great things about the hotel was the clenliness of the rooms and showers which is the most important point for me when staying in a hotel. The beds were changed daily and we could not fault the very helpful staff. The wired thing that happened was the battery in our safe went leaving us without lots of things overnight and halfway thru the next day. TV volume only goes to a certain volume so can be difficult to hear during the day time. The metro is close by and easy to navigate around. I have stayed in other hotels in paris where the streets were noisy at night but this one was quite. The walls are a bit thin which can be uncomfortable when the idiot upstairs wants to fall asleep with his tv on. I did call up and advise him it was in his healths best interests to keep quite so it was fine in the end. The room was very small but overall the hotel is fantastic for someone looking for a nice clean room whith helpful staff and many shops etc on your doorstep.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Montparnasse Daguerre
HotelInfo.Address: 94 rue Daguerre | 14th Arr., 75014 Paris, France
